offence: Enhanced penalties for offences alleged to have been committed against domestic workers
bailable: According as to whether the offence alleged to have been committed against or in relation to the person is bailable or not
punishment: Up to twice the punishment provided for the offence

offence: Enhanced penalties for offences alleged to have been committed against vulnerable persons
bailable: According as to whether the offence alleged to have been committed against or in relation to the person is bailable or not
punishment: Up to twice the punishment provided for the offence

offence: Enhanced penalties for offences alleged to have been committed against child below 14 years of age
bailable: According as to whether the offence alleged to have been committed against or in relation to the person is bailable or not
punishment: Up to twice the punishment provided for the offence

offence: Abetment of any offence, if the act abetted is committed in consequence, and where no express provision is made for its punishment
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence abetted is bailable or not
punishment: The same punishment as for the offence abetted

offence: Abetment of any offence, if the person abetted does the act with a different intention from that of the abettor
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence abetted is bailable or not
punishment: The same punishment as for the offence abetted

offence: Abetment of any offence, when one act is abetted and a different act is done; subject to the proviso
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence abetted is bailable or not
punishment: The same punishment as for the offence intended to be abetted

offence: Abetment of any offence, when an effect is caused by the act abetted different from that intended by the abettor
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence abetted is bailable or not
punishment: The same punishment as for the offence committed

offence: Abetment of any offence, if the abettor is present when the offence is committed
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence abetted is bailable or not
punishment: The same punishment as for the offence committed

offence: Abetment of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, if the offence is not committed in consequence of the abetment
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, and fine, or caning

offence: Abetment of an offence punishable with imprisonment, if the offence is not committed in consequence of the abetment
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence abetted is bailable or not
punishment: The same punishment as for the offence abetted, provided that any mandatory minimum sentence or sentence fixed by law does not apply

offence: Abetting the commission of an offence by the public, or by more than 10 persons
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence abetted is bailable or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: Concealing a design to commit an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, if the offence is committed
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: If the offence is not committed
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, and fine

offence: A public servant concealing a design to commit an offence which it is his or her duty to prevent, if the offence is committed
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence abetted is bailable or not
punishment: Imprisonment extending to half of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both

offence: If the offence is punishable with death or imprisonment for life
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: If the offence is not committed
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence abetted is bailable or not
punishment: Imprisonment extending to a quarter of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both

offence: If the offence is punishable with death or imprisonment for life but is not committed
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Concealing a design to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment, if the offence is committed
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence is bailable or not
punishment: Imprisonment extending to a quarter of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both

offence: If the offence is not committed
arrestable: May arrest without warrant, if arrest for the offence abetted may be made without warrant but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence abetted
bailable: According as to whether the offence is bailable or not
punishment: Imprisonment extending to one-eighth of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both

offence: Criminal conspiracy
arrestable: May arrest without warrant if arrest for the offence which is the subject of the conspiracy may be made without warrant, but not otherwise
warrant: According as to whether warrant or summons may issue for the offence which is the subject of the conspiracy
bailable: According as to whether the offence which is the subject of the conspiracy is bailable or not
punishment: The same punishment as if the offence which is the subject of the conspiracy was abetted

offence: Waging or attempting to wage war, or abetting the waging of war, against the Government
punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life

offence: Offences against the President's person
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Offences against authority
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Abetting offences under section 121A or 121B
punishment: Punishment provided for offences under section 121A or 121B

offence: Intentional omission to give information of offences against section 121, 121A, 121B or 121C
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, or fine, or both

offence: Collecting arms, etc., with the intention of waging war against the Government
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Concealing with intent to facilitate a design to wage war
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Assaulting the President, etc., with intent to compel or restrain the exercise of any lawful power
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Waging war against any power in alliance or at peace with the Government or abetting the waging of such war
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 15 years, and fine, or fine

offence: Committing depredation on the territories of any power in alliance or at peace with the Government
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine, and forfeiture of certain property

offence: Receiving property taken by war or depredation mentioned in sections 125 and 126
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine, and forfeiture of property so received

offence: Public servant voluntarily allowing prisoner of State or war in his or her custody to escape
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Public servant negligently suffering prisoner of State or war in his or her custody to escape
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Aiding escape of, rescuing, or harbouring, such prisoner, or offering any resistance to the recapture of such prisoner
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Piracy by law of nations
punishment: Imprisonment for life, and caning

offence: While committing or attempting to commit piracy, the person commits murder or attempts to commit murder, or does any act which is likely to endanger the life of another person
punishment: Death

offence: Piratical acts
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and caning

offence: Genocide where offence consists of the killing of any person
punishment: Death

offence: Genocide in any other case
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 20 years

offence: Abetting mutiny, or attempting to seduce an officer, a sailor, a soldier or an airman from his or her allegiance or duty
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence thereof
punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Abetment of an assault by an officer, a sailor, a soldier or an airman on his or her superior officer, when in the execution of his or her office
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, and fine

offence: Abetment of such assault, if the assault is committed
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Abetment of the desertion of an officer, a sailor, a soldier or an airman
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Harbouring an officer, a sailor, a soldier or an airman who has deserted
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel, through negligence of master or person in charge thereof
punishment: Fine

offence: Abetment of act of insubordination by an officer, a sailor, a soldier or an airman, if the offence is committed in consequence
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Wearing garb or carrying any token used by a sailor, a soldier or an airman with intent that it may be believed that he or she is such
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Being member of an unlawful assembly
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Joining an unlawful assembly armed with any deadly weapon
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or caning, or any combination of such punishments

offence: Joining or continuing in an unlawful assembly, knowing that it has been commanded to disperse
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: Rioting
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and caning

offence: Rioting, armed with a deadly weapon
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and caning

offence: Offence committed by member of an unlawful assembly, other members guilty
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
warrant: According as to whether a warrant or summons may issue for the offence
bailable: According as to whether the offence is bailable or not
punishment: The same as for the offence

offence: Hiring, engaging or employing persons to take part in an unlawful assembly
warrant: According to the offence committed by the person hired, engaged or employed
bailable: According as to whether the offence is bailable or not
punishment: The same as for a member of such assembly, and for any offence committed by any member of such assembly

offence: Knowingly joining or continuing in any assembly of 5 or more persons after it has been commanded to disperse
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 8 years, or fine, or both

offence: Intentionally or rashly giving provocation with intent to cause riot, if rioting is committed
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: If not committed
punishment: Imprisonment for one year, or fine, or both

offence: Owner or occupier of land not giving information of riot, etc.
punishment: Fine

offence: Person for whose benefit or on whose behalf a riot takes place not using all lawful means to prevent it
punishment: Fine

offence: Agent of owner or occupier for whose benefit a riot is committed not using all lawful means to prevent it
punishment: Fine

offence: Harbouring persons hired for an unlawful assembly
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Being hired to take part in an unlawful assembly or riot
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Or to go armed
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: Being or expecting to be a public servant, and taking a gratification other than legal remuneration in respect of an official act
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Taking a gratification in order, by corrupt or illegal means, to influence a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Taking a gratification for the exercise of personal influence with a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for one year, or fine, or both

offence: Abetment by public servant of the offences defined in sections 162 and 163 with reference to himself or herself
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Public servant obtaining any valuable thing, without consideration, from a person concerned in any proceeding or business transacted by the public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Public servant disobeying a direction of the law with intent to cause injury to any person
punishment: Imprisonment for one year, or fine, or both

offence: Public servant framing an incorrect document or electronic record with intent to cause injury
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade
punishment: Imprisonment for one year, or fine, or both

offence: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both, and confiscation of property, if purchased

offence: Personating a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding from a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for one month, or fine, or both

offence: If summons or notice requires attendance in person, etc., in a court of justice
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Preventing the service or the affixing of any summons or notice, or the removal of it when it has been affixed, or preventing a proclamation
punishment: Imprisonment for one month, or fine, or both

offence: If summons, etc., requires attendance in person, etc., in a court of justice
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Not obeying a legal order to attend at a certain place in person or by agent, or departing therefrom without authority
punishment: Imprisonment for one month, or fine, or both

offence: If the order requires personal attendance, etc., in a court of justice
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Intentionally omitting to produce a document or an electronic record to a public servant by a person legally bound to produce or deliver such document or electronic record
punishment: Imprisonment for one month, or fine, or both

offence: Intentionally omitting to give notice or information to a public servant by a person legally bound to give the notice or information
punishment: Imprisonment for one month, or fine, or both

offence: If the notice or information required respects the commission of an offence, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Knowingly furnishing false information to a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: If the information required respects the commission of an offence, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Refusing oath when duly required to take an oath by a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Being legally bound to state truth, and refusing to answer questions to a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Refusing to sign a statement made to a public servant when legally required to do so
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 months, or fine, or both

offence: Knowingly stating to a public servant on oath as true that which is false
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, and fine

offence: Giving false information to a public servant in order to cause him or her to use his or her lawful power to the injury or annoyance of any person
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Resistance to the taking of property by the lawful authority of a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Obstructing sale of property offered for sale by authority of a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for one month, or fine, or both

offence: Bidding by a person under a legal incapacity to purchase it, for property at a lawfully authorised sale, or bidding without intending to perform the obligations incurred thereby
punishment: Imprisonment for one month, or fine, or both

offence: Obstructing public servant in discharge of his or her public functions
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Omission to assist public servant when bound by law to give such assistance
punishment: Imprisonment for one month, or fine, or both

offence: Wilfully neglecting to aid a public servant who demands aid in the execution of process, the prevention of offences, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Disobedience to an order lawfully promulgated by a public servant, if such disobedience causes obstruction, annoyance or injury to persons lawfully employed
punishment: Imprisonment for one month, or fine, or both

offence: If such disobedience causes danger to human life, health or safety, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Threatening a public servant with injury to him or her, or one in whom he or she is interested, to induce him or her to do or forbear to do any official act
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Threatening any person to induce the person to refrain from making a legal application for protection from injury
punishment: Imprisonment for one year, or fine, or both

offence: Giving or fabricating false evidence in a judicial proceeding
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Giving or fabricating false evidence in any other case
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, and fine

offence: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to cause any person to be convicted of a capital offence
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: If innocent person is thereby convicted and executed
punishment: Death, or as above

offence: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of an offence punishable with imprisonment for 7 years or upwards
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: The same as for the offence

offence: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of an offence punishable with imprisonment for life
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years

offence: Corruptly using or attempting to use evidence known to be false or fabricated
punishment: The same as for giving or fabricating false evidence

offence: Knowingly issuing or signing a false certificate relating to any fact of which that certificate is by law admissible in evidence
punishment: The same as for giving false evidence

offence: Using as a true certificate one known to be false in a material point
punishment: The same as for giving false evidence

offence: False statement made in any declaration which is by law receivable as evidence
punishment: The same as for giving false evidence

offence: Using as true any such declaration known to be false
punishment: The same as for giving false evidence

offence: Causing disappearance of evidence of an offence committed, or giving false information touching it, to screen the offender, if the offence is capital
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 20 years
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for less than 20 years
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for a quarter of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both

offence: Intentional omission to give information of an offence by a person legally bound to inform
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both

offence: Giving false information respecting an offence committed
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Secreting or destroying any document or electronic record to prevent its production as evidence
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Obstructing, preventing, perverting or defeating course of justice
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both

offence: Bribery of witnesses
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both

offence: False personation for the purpose of any act or proceeding in a suit or criminal prosecution, or for becoming bail or security
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Fraudulent removal or concealment, etc., of property to prevent its seizure as a forfeiture or in satisfaction of a fine under sentence, or in execution of a decree, or under or pursuant to an enforcement order
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Claiming property without right, or practising deception touching any right to it, to prevent its being taken as a forfeiture, or in satisfaction of a fine under sentence, or in execution of a decree, or under or pursuant to an enforcement order
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Fraudulently suffering a decree to pass for a sum not due, or suffering decree to be executed or enforced after it has been satisfied
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Fraudulently obtaining a decree for a sum not due, or causing a decree to be executed or enforced after it has been satisfied
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: False charge of offence made with intent to injure
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: If offence charged is punishable with death, or imprisonment for 7 years or upwards
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Harbouring an offender, if the offence is capital
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 20 years
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for one year and not for 20 years
punishment: Imprisonment for a quarter of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both

offence: Taking gift, etc., to screen an offender from punishment, if the offence is capital
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 20 years
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for less than 20 years
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for a quarter of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both

offence: Offering gift or restoration of property in consideration of screening offender, if the offence is capital
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 20 years
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for less than 20 years
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for a quarter of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both

offence: Taking gift to help to recover movable property of which a person has been deprived by an offence, without causing apprehension of offender
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Harbouring an offender who has escaped from custody, or whose apprehension has been ordered, if the offence is capital
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 20 years
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for one year and not for 20 years
punishment: Imprisonment for a quarter of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both

offence: Harbouring robbers or gang-robbers
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Public servant disobeying a direction of law with intent to save person from punishment, or property from forfeiture
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Public servant framing an incorrect record or writing with intent to save person from punishment, or property from forfeiture
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Public servant in a judicial proceeding corruptly making or pronouncing an order, a report, a verdict or a decision which he or she knows to be contrary to law
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both

offence: Commitment for trial or confinement by a person having authority, who knows that he or she is acting contrary to law
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both

offence: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of a public servant bound by law to apprehend an offender, if the offence is capital
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 20 years
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: If punishable with imprisonment for less than 20 years
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of a public servant bound by law to apprehend person under sentence of a court of justice, if under sentence of death
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: If under sentence of imprisonment for 20 years or upwards
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If under sentence of imprisonment for less than 20 years, or lawfully committed to custody
arrestable: According as to whether arrest may be made without warrant for the offence or not
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both

offence: Escape from confinement negligently suffered by a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Resistance or obstruction by a person to his or her lawful apprehension
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Resistance or obstruction to the lawful apprehension of another person, or rescuing him or her from lawful custody
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: If charged with an offence punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 20 years
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: If charged with a capital offence
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If the person is sentenced to imprisonment for 10 years or upwards
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If under sentence of death
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of a public servant bound by law to apprehend any person in a case not provided for by section 221, 222 or 223
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Negligent omission to do same
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Resistance or obstruction by a person to the lawful apprehension of himself or herself or any other person in a case not otherwise provided for
punishment: Imprisonment for one year, or fine, or both

offence: Illegal act or omission for which punishment is not provided
punishment: Fine

offence: Unlawful return from banishment
punishment: Imprisonment for the original term of banishment or expulsion, and fine

offence: Violation of condition of remission of punishment
punishment: Punishment of original sentence, or, if part of the punishment has been undergone, the residue

offence: Intentional insult or interruption to a public servant sitting in any stage of a judicial proceeding
punishment: Imprisonment for one year, or fine, or both

offence: Personation of an assessor
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Counterfeiting a Government stamp
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Having possession of an instrument or material for the purpose of counterfeiting a Government stamp
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Making, buying or selling instrument for the purpose of counterfeiting a Government stamp
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Sale of counterfeit Government stamp
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Having possession of a counterfeit Government stamp
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Using as genuine a Government stamp known to be counterfeit
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both

offence: Effacing any writing from a substance bearing a Government stamp, or removing from a document a stamp used for it with intent to cause loss to Government
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Using a Government stamp known to have been before used
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Receiving or retaining stolen property, knowing it to be stolen
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: If the stolen property is a motor vehicle or any component part thereof
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, and fine, and disqualification for such period as the court may order from holding or obtaining a driving licence

offence: Receiving property stolen in the commission of gang-robbery
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Habitually dealing in stolen property
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Assisting in concealment or disposal of stolen property, knowing it to be stolen
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: If the stolen property is a motor vehicle or any component part thereof
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, and fine, and disqualification for such period as the court may order from holding or obtaining a driving licence

offence: Illegally obtained personal information
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Cheating
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Cheating a person whose interest the offender was bound, either by law or by legal contract, to protect
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: Cheating by personation
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: Cheating and thereby dishonestly inducing delivery of property, or the making, alteration or destruction of a valuable security
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Obtaining services dishonestly or fraudulently
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, or fine, or both

offence: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property, etc., to prevent distribution among creditors
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Fraudulently preventing from being made available for creditors a debt or demand due to the offender
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Fraudulent execution of deed of transfer containing a false statement of consideration
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property of the person or any other person, or assisting in the doing, thereof, or dishonestly releasing any demand or claim to which the person is entitled
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Fraud by false representation, non-disclosure or abuse of position not connected with contracts for goods or services
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, or fine, or both

offence: Fraud by false representation, non-disclosure or abuse of position - where otherwise
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, or fine, or both

offence: Mischief
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Mischief, and thereby causing disruption to key service, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, or fine, or both

offence: Mischief by killing, poisoning, maiming or rendering useless, any animal
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: Mischief by fire or explosive substance
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy a house, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a decked vessel or a vessel of 20 tons burden
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: The mischief described in section 437 when committed by fire or any explosive substance
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Running vessel ashore with intent to commit theft, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Mischief committed after preparation made for causing death or hurt, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, and fine

offence: Criminal trespass
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 months, or fine, or both

offence: House-breaking
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: House-breaking in order to commit an offence punishable with death
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: House-breaking in order to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment for life
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: House-breaking in order to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: House-breaking, after preparation made for causing hurt, assault, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine, or caning

offence: Possession of house-breaking implements or offensive weapons
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both and forfeiture of any instrument or article found in the possession of that person

offence: Committing an offence under section 449, 450, 451 or 452 subsequent to having been convicted of an offence under section 449, 450, 451 or 452
punishment: Caning in addition to the punishment prescribed for the offence

offence: Grievous hurt caused while committing house-breaking
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, and caning

offence: Death or grievous hurt caused by one of several persons jointly concerned in house-breaking
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years

offence: Dishonestly breaking open or unfastening any closed receptacle containing or supposed to contain property
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Being entrusted with any closed receptacle containing or supposed to contain any property, and fraudulently opening the same
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Forgery
punishment: Imprisonment for 4 years, or fine, or both

offence: Forgery of a record of a court of justice or of a register of births, etc., kept by a public servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Forgery of a valuable security, will, or authority to make or transfer any valuable security, or to receive any money, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Forgery for the purpose of cheating
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Forgery for the purpose of harming the reputation of any person, or knowing that it is likely to be used for that purpose
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, and fine

offence: Using as genuine a forged document or forged electronic record which is known to be forged
punishment: Punishment for forgery

offence: Making or counterfeiting a seal, plate, etc., with intent to commit a forgery punishable under section 467, or possessing with like intent any such seal, plate, etc., knowing the same to be counterfeit
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Making or counterfeiting a seal, plate, etc., with intent to commit a forgery punishable otherwise than under section 467, or possessing with like intent any such seal, plate, etc., knowing the same to be counterfeit
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Making or possessing equipment for making false instrument
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

offence: Making or possessing equipment for making false instrument with intent to induce prejudice
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, or fine, or both

offence: Having possession of a document or an electronic record knowing it to be forged, with intent to use it as genuine, if the document or electronic record is one of the descriptions mentioned in section 466
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: If the document is one of the descriptions mentioned in section 467
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Counterfeiting a device or mark used for authenticating documents described in section 467, or possessing counterfeit marked material
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Counterfeiting a device or mark used for authenticating documents or electronic records other than those described in section 467, or possessing counterfeit marked material
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Fraudulently destroying or defacing, or attempting to destroy or deface, or secreting a will, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Falsification of accounts by clerk or servant
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, or fine, or both

offence: Forging or counterfeiting currency or bank notes
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Using as genuine forged or counterfeit currency or bank notes
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Possession of forged or counterfeit currency or bank notes, with intent
punishment: Imprisonment for 15 years, and fine

offence: Making or possessing instruments or materials for forging or counterfeiting currency or bank notes
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, and fine

offence: Abetting in Singapore counterfeiting of currency out of Singapore
punishment: The punishment provided for abetting the counterfeiting of such currency within Singapore

offence: Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of coin
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Altering appearance of currency with intent that it passes as currency of different description
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine

offence: Delivering to another of altered currency
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine

offence: Possession of altered currency
punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, and fine

offence: Defamation
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Printing or engraving matter knowing it to be defamatory
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Sale of printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter, knowing it to contain such matter
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: Insult intended to provoke a breach of the peace
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: False statement, rumour, etc., circulated with intent to cause mutiny or offence against the public peace
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both

offence: Criminal intimidation
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both

offence: If threat is to cause death or grievous hurt, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, or fine, or both

offence: Criminal intimidation by anonymous communication or having taken precaution to conceal from where the threat comes
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, in addition to the punishment under section 506

offence: Attempting (where no express provision is made by the Penal Code 1871 or by other written law) to commit offences punishable with death or imprisonment for life
punishment: Imprisonment for 20 years, and fine, or caning

offence: If the attempted offence is punishable with any punishment or combination of punishments other than death or imprisonment for life
arrestable: According as to whether the offence is one in respect of which the police may arrest without warrant or not
warrant: According as to whether the offence is one in respect of which a summons or warrant shall ordinarily issue
bailable: According as to whether the offence attempted is bailable or not
punishment: The punishment provided for the offence, except that the court is not bound to impose any specified minimum sentence or mandatory minimum sentence of imprisonment, or fine or caning
